review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

review:
＼ｽﾀｰﾊﾞｰｲｷｰﾝｸﾞ／　＼ﾊﾞｰｲｷｰﾝ／　＼ﾊﾞｰｲｷｰﾝ／

口の汚い宇宙海賊Thorkくん（北欧神話のトール神と、余計なお喋りばっかりするトークをもじった名前だと思う）と
連れのイカれた仲間たちで、侵略者カタツムリどもをコテンパンにやり返しに行くぜ！聖戦ラグナロクだ！って
頭の悪い感じのシナリオの、パズルストラテジーゲーム
詰将棋的なゲームが好きな人にはおすすめ

ゲームシステムについては
目の前に行って殴ると反撃されるので、スキルを使って遠距離でちまちま攻撃してから
スキルポイントをケチるために、トドメを刺すときだけ近づいていって
近接攻撃で倒す…ってのが基本戦術となっている
あくまで基本なので、近づいて倒さない方が良い爆発する系の敵もいるし
近づいても一切反撃はしてこないが、硬い・放置していると攻撃してくるやっかいな種類の敵もいるので
敵の湧き構成によっては、処理する順番をある程度吟味しなければならないゲーム性は
インディーズながら非常に良く出来ていると思う

ただ問題は難易度に関してが少々粗削り
序盤は敵が強くて難しいゲームにも思えて苦戦しがちだが
結局のところ先に経験値ファーミングして、レベルを上げてスキルで殴れば
攻略に5分かかるマップも1分ぐらいで終わらせる事が出来てしまうのはちょっと何とかならんのかと思った
時間効率的にも頭を使って戦うよりも、めんどくさいレベリングを先に数十分やって楽したほうが
金も溜まって新しい仲間も雇用できたりアップグレードもアンロックできるため
実は本編中、頭を使う要素はあんまりないし必要なかったりする…
逆に言えばレベル上げが嫌いで、プレイヤーの判断能力で戦いたいって思ってる人は
ACT 3～4の間で発生する主人公が一時離脱するイベントで
今まで主人公を主軸に戦ってた人にはレベルがカツカツで
他のPTメンバーだけじゃ役に立たず、ろくに戦えなくなって
半ばゲームが詰んで進行不可のような（あくまでレベル上げしない場合の話だけど）状態になってしまう
遊び方が制限されてるように感じたため、レベル上げ必須なシステムには正直言って萎えた…

まあこれだけ聞くとクソゲーに思えるけど
RPGとかのレベル上げに抵抗がないって人には
主人公が戻ってくるまで別のキャラビルドを新しく雇用して育てて遊べるじゃん！ってプラスにも考えられるし
良くも悪くも強制的にゲームが進行不可にならないよう逃げ道を作ってるので
一長一短で、一概に悪い要素とも言い難い

それとクリア後に遊ぶ事が出来るエンドコンテンツでは
本編だとレベルを上げて殴って倒せばよかったのが
敵の火力・硬さが爆上がりして行くのに加えて
キャラクターのレベルやパラメータがカンストになったりして限界があるため
本編のような単純に物理で殴ればいいだろ脳死プレイはできず
流石に頭を使わないと攻略できない場面が多々出て来る
頭を使って遊びたい人は、本編クリア後から気合入れて遊ぼう
[strike]（そこまでして戦術組んで遊びたいなら、こんなゲーム買わずに他のゲーム買った方が良いと思うけど）[/strike]

あと一長一短とかじゃなくて、単に短所として気になった点をあげるなら
開発者が完全に開発を途中で投げっぱなしにした部分にある
このゲームはキャラは加入したら加入しっぱなしなので
金が余ってるからとかたっぱしから味方を加入させていくと
PT編集画面が見づらくなって、操作にストレスを感じるようになってくる
昔は増えすぎたキャラクターを削除できるようにDELETEボタン置いてあったらしいけど
不具合があったためDELETEボタンを一旦削除
その後また取り付けられるかと思われたが…
熱心にユーザの声を聴いていた開発者だったが、ある日を境にゲーム開発に飽きたのか匙を投げたっぽいので
ユーザが出していた意見に関しては、この先も永遠に実装される事はないだろう

一応エンディングまで遊べるし、値段相応のゲームボリュームではあるからしょうがないんだけど
中身は早期アクセスと大差ないと思って買った方が精神衛生上は良いと思う
購入の際はよく考えてから買った方が良いぞ！

review:
More in my Video Review:
https://youtu.be/BilYAP_b_Ls

Is Star Vikings Forever just a cheap mobile port or does it have enough qualities to offer a worthwhile experience even on computers? There are many pros - humorous story, funny and distinctive game characters, more possible solutions for each puzzle,  replayability thanks to procedurally generated levels, variety of skill upgrades and power-ups, difficulty suitable for casual players, beautiful graphics, nice to hear music and sounds. However, one can also find some cons - slow progress of unlocking new characters, a little bit clunky controls suitable rather for cellphones than PCs, absence of dubbing and creeping stereotype resulting from simplicity of the game concept. Star Vikings Forever is definitely a family friendly game thanks to short levels, casual difficulty and omnipresent humor. 

Pros:
- humor
- game characters
- more possible solutions
- replayability
- upgrades and power-ups
- casual difficulty
- graphics, music and sounds

Cons:
- slow progress of unlocking characters
- controls are rather designed for mobiles
- no dubbing
- creeping stereotype

If you are looking for an easy to learn puzzle game that can be funny even when played in short seances and is surprisingly complex in its core you are on the right address. Star Vikings Forever is an ideal game for casual family playing and I have enjoyed it despite its flaws and the fact that it will probably not last for too long and thus I am giving it Thumbs Up and VideoGaming Father’s Index 7 out of 10 - recommended with some discount.

这游戏有手机安卓版，游戏还行，虽然拇指向下还是推荐。不过，看上去是解谜游戏，实际是要刷刷刷练级就有些肝了，这点也差评。一周目大概15小时左右，最后boss战斗还有点意思。连击还满有趣爽快。后期游玩大概30小时左右的rank试炼的关卡24，25还满有挑战性；30以后道具随机也满有趣，肉鸽元素拉满。剧透：[spoiler]看上去回合制，但是还是有点改进，不用一个角色移动完就可以对下个角色下达命令。二周目完毕后，挑战rank试炼34以后的关卡，看上去就是堆数值，重复刷了，没什么乐趣样的（和好友一起挑战排行榜，且试炼关卡每过几关有不同的随机环境还有些乐趣）。[/spoiler]

不足，bug或建议等：飞船在地图上走的动画比较慢应该可以跳过，但是不行；可以打开队伍菜单，再返回就发现飞船瞬移可节省时间，这可能是bug。rank试炼的关卡可以左右换等级按钮不明显，还以为就1个等级，应该闪烁提示的。当快速干掉一个敌人，又快速选择主角能量炮技能点击那个被干掉的敌人时，会长亮地块。清场后应该有个全体自动前进键，免得一个个去拉繁琐了。成就加20个朋友在游戏里排行榜竞争有些过了，难完成，感觉这成就完全是为了厂家做的；而且好像还得好友到排行榜那关并上榜才行，好像排行榜里只显示10个？看到的加个？建议游戏里的试炼排行榜可以在游戏外不需要打开游戏就可以看见。20连击的成就太简单了，剧透：[spoiler]它不是计算单次攻击。[/spoiler]制作帽子界面，连续按回车确定的时候，有几率不能退出。盾的增益状态是否持续有些看不清，应当更醒目点。建议增加世界排行榜。洛基之角帽的说明不贴切，“五人小队的每位成员都加一点普通攻击”应当为“五人小队的每位成员都加一点普通攻击并反伤时也加一点”。

En gros, il s'agit bien d'un Puzzle Game de planification pour passer de la façon la plus optimale possible: tuer un maximum d'ennemis pour avoir de l'XP pour upgrader vos persos (il ne faut en théorie, pas forcément tuer les ennemis, ce qui compte, c'est de passer, mais si vous ne tuez personne, vous ne gagnez pas d'XP. Pareil pour l'or, utiliser pour acheter des consommables, vous n'êtes pas obligez de le ramasser mais c'est mieux si vous le faite.

L'enrobage graphique ? Lol!
Le son? Ouais pas mal, c'est correct, j'aime bien, en tout cas, j'ai pas perdu mon audition, c'est bien non? mais soyons honnête, la musique, quand tu réfléchis pendant 5 minutes sur un écran, elle finit par tapper sur le système, surtout qu'elle dure 40 secondes et qu'elle est entêtante (dou dou dou doudidoudou) 
L'histoire? On s'en fout mais au moins, elle est rigolote et c'est cool d'être rigolo, ça donne +5 en sympathie à un scénario quand il y a de l'humour. 

Si le côté puzzle game est vraiment sympa, même si on a déjà vu ce genre de jeu, on peut tout de même pester sur le farm ulta présent pour augmenter le niveau de ses vikings ou faire les challenges pour les achievements. Car au final, ce n'est pas la courte histoire  qui fait le coeur du jeu, c'est le end game avec des challenges aléatoires, des quêtes journalières pour grinder, dommage mais c'est lié à son origine mobile.

Si on excepte ce côté désagréable, on se retrouve quand même face à un petit jeu prenant qui peut vous occuper quelques heures, donc au final pourquoi pas? Puis au pire, si vous êtes du genre nomade, vous pouvez toujours y jouer sur tablette/téléphone ou le grind semble plus acceptable, vaguement.

review:
[h1]Follow our [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/36214917/]Curator Group for more reviews[/url][/h1]

Star Vikings Forever is a turn-based strategy game. The game is clearly designed for mobile, with little work done to port it to PC. Because of this, gameplay is relatively shallow and simplistic. Rather than have complicated mechanics or tactical depth, the levels unfold more like puzzles that you need to solve. Without grinding your characters, most levels are usually only completable in 1 or 2 ways. This makes the game inevitably become stale and boring. The progression also seems like they forgot to rebalance it once the micro-transactions were removed, leading to an extremely annoying grind. Overall, it's a mobile port that needed more work in order to be a worthwhile game.

EDIT: I was wrong about it being a mobile port, it was actually ported to mobile from PC. This doesn't change my opinion of the game, but a lot of my assumptions and guesses turned out to be wrong.

[h1]   Star Vikings Forever    [/h1]
Это необычная головоломка, в которой присутствует много интересных и нелинейных миссий.
Игра сделана для того, чтобы игрок мог испытать свои тактичные навыки и улучшать их.
Разработчики всё трудятся ей и всегда улучшать многое.

[h1]   Геймплей   [/h1]
Совершенно простая и весёлая космическая стратегия, в которой вы играете за викинга, которому предстоит проходить уровни уничтожая разных видов монстров.

Помимо убийства разных видов существ вам предстоит собирать монеты, чтобы улучшать своего викинга и его оружие.
С каждым вашим ударом снижается энергия, на каждый уровень её даётся по разному, так-что чтобы пройти уровень надо не только убить всех, но и подумать как бы сэкономить на энергии и не умереть от ударов врагов.

Первое время очень просто пройти уровни, сложности почти и нету, ведь вас обучают всему, как мыслить тактически и пользоваться этим чтобы получить преимущество над врагом.

[h1] Оптимизация [/h1]
Игра идёт даже на самых слабых компьютерах, особой нагрузки она не приносит, ведь это всё же порт мобильной игры.
Минимальные системные требования неважны, играючи на слабом ноутбуке фризов никаких не было. 
Оптимизация это огромный плюс, из-за которого я поднял оценку игры.

[h1] [+] Плюсы и Минусы [-]   [/h1]

[h1]   Плюсы  [/h1]

1.Совершенно уникальный игровой процесс.
2.Игра в целом неплохо сделана и больших ошибок я не наблюдал.
3.Разные персонажи, враги и уровни.
4.Есть обновления, которые также меняют геймплей игры, делая её больше и интересней
5.Есть несколько необязательных задач.

[h1] Минусы [/h1]

1.Случайные сгенерированные стволы могут иметь большие различия в сложности
2.Игра, похоже, тоже сделана с мобильным телефоном.
3.Игра становится немного хрустящей, а случайность не всегда весело.


[h1] Оценка  [/h1]
Довольно неплохая и в то же время простая игра, в которой есть очень много интересных и по-настоящему крутых фишек, благодаря которым игра заслужила 7/10.

review:
It's a nice casual strategy game with some RPG elements to it.
With a name like Star Vikings Forever it's not a game that takes itself seriously and tries being funny and ridiculous. You control a crew of vikings on a mission while having to fight your way through space snails. There are 6 different viking classes with unique skills and abilities you get to chose from as they level up. There are 4 worlds to play through, and a new game + continuation after beating the 4th world that has more difficult enemies. There are a bunch of hats with different stats and bonuses that your vikings can equip, and you can combine them to receive upgraded versions with better stats.
All in all it's a pretty decent game and I'd recommend it if your into this kind of stuff and want something to burn a few hours playing through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160755391', 'num_games_owned': 1362, 'num_reviews': 383, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1525652505}
review:
Star Vikings Forever – эпичное приключение викингов в жанре RPG.

Волей случая викингам достался артефакт, который очень дорог обитателям планеты улиток. Брюхоногие моллюски довольно дружелюбно настроены ко всем расам без исключения, они даже отправили на космический корабль викингов парламентёра, чтобы договориться как разумные существа и не развязывать войну. Но вы ведь знаете викингов, их хлебом не корми, дай только войну затеять. К тому же артефакт уже был приспособлен как подпорка под стол, чтобы тот не шатался. Массовое сражение из-за пустяка. Кажется, самый разумный на корабле викингов это робот О.Д.И.Н, который очень негодует, что его хозяева готовы рискнуть всем ради бесполезной каменной улитки.

Вам предстоит управлять командой викингов, нанимать и отправлять в запас различных персонажей в зависимости от уровня и задачи, так как у каждого персонажа свой уникальный набор навыков. Присутствует система прокачки персонажа, навыки прокачиваются за игровое золото, которого вам всегда будет не хватать. Игра очень атмосферная и захватывающая, особенно понравится любителям жанра RPG. В игре очень интересная сюжетная линия, диалоги насыщены юмором, графика довольно красочная, очень много возможностей пройти уровень разными способами. Если вам потребуется больше опыта или золота, то можно пройти уровень ещё раз, однако он уже будет выглядеть по другому, но цель завершения останется прежней. Сложность, как это и принято в играх на логику, идёт по наростающей. Если первые уровни больше носят обучающий характер, чтобы познакомить игрока с возможностями и правилами данной игры, то уже к концу первого акта вам придётся больше думать, так как каждый неверный шаг может закончится смертью викинга. А потеря одного из участников команды может очень печально сказаться на остальных. Вам придётся изучать противника и играть на его слабостях. В честном бою не одолеть огромные армии моллюсков, но не переживайте, эти брюхоногие настолько глупы, что бьют друг друга при любом удобном случае, так что мозг это ваше главное оружие. 

Но есть и некоторые моменты, которые разочаровывают. Продвигаясь по карте у вас будут открываться новые уровни, которые нельзя посетить из-за того что один из членов команды не достиг нужного уровня, видимо это не толерантно по отношению к остальным викингам. Двигаясь дальше по открытому направлению у вас из головы вылетит то, что позади остался не завершённый уровень, хотя условия для входа уже давно соответствуют. Но это всё мелочь, так как геймплей игры очень уникален и насыщен разнообразным контентом.

Приведите викингов к победе, сама Валькирия на вашей стороне (в буквальном смысле).

review:
I love these kinds of light strategy games. 

Pros:
Easy enough.
Always seems that if I don't pay careful attention I end up hurting myself.
Feels like you have lots of options in the load out of your Vikings, and you can play it how you want to play it if you are willing to work for the hats that make your strategy work.
There's a good amount of game, especially if you want most of the achievements.

Cons:
I seemed to have an issue if I let a Viking die in front of another Viking, the one left alive would not step past the dead Vikings last spot.  Think that's a bug.  
Didn't like that if you got stuck on a round the only option to restart was either to let yourself die, or restart all levels in that round.  I suspect that's to stop you from messing with the inventory in sneaky ways, but you can already do that with the current setup if a chest appears on the first level.  
Some of the achievements are grindy.  (Road to Valhalla X )
Road to Valhalla IX achievement basically says you need to convince 19 of your friends to buy the game.  Uh.... That sounds kinda cash grabby.  

I got this in a bundle, so it was like less then a buck.  Based on that it gets a big thumbs up....... Definitely worth that.  At the Ten store price, I'd actually give a negative.  If you get it on sale for 3-5 that's probably good.

review:
Star Vikings is actually a bit like Plant vs. Zombies - but you play the Zombies not the plants. It is a reversed tower defense game, where you have to destroy the towers (slugs) to get through. You have a variety of "heroes" in your arsenal, the tank, able to withstand a lot of damage, the viking, able to throw lightning on the slugs, "angels" able to cast shields (and healing), ...

Each hero can wear a hat, giving him some bonuses, like extra damage, extra energy, more hitpoints, ...

It is a worthwile casual game and quite nice to play.
On the downside:
- Some daily quests simply don't work (and some are somewhat stupid/annoying)
- Some achievements are somewhat bugged. No idea how to get the Leaderboard achievement (I guess, the Friends/Leaderboard feature was simply not implemented yet).
- You need to do a lot of grinding to get the more difficult achievements
- The interface is somewhat optimized for tablets. Not a big deal, but I guess, it would be perfect to play it on a tablet on not with a mouse.

Still, the bugs are mostly minor, I recommend this game to casual players, looking for a reversed tower defense game. Btw.: The game works flawless on Linux (with Mesa drivers).

review:
Je suis étonné que ce jeu ait si peu d'évaluations alors je m'attèle à la tâche.

Dans ce jeu, le développeur s'est lancé dans un pari osé : il a introduit de la gestion procédurale dans un puzzle game / jeu de réflexion. Cela aurait pu très mal se finir avec des niveaux infaisables ou ridiculement faciles, mais au final le tout reste balancé et cohérent. On ajoutera à ça des nouveaux ennemis et héros possédant de nouvelles mécaniques qui arrivent tout au long de l'aventure et brisent la routine.

Sur la forme, les sprites sont soignés et suffisamment différents pour bien identifier les mécaniques des ennemis et l'on est accompagné d'une musique entrainante avec un côté métal (peu commun comme choix pour un jeu de réflexion cela dit).

Sachant qu'une démo est disponible, je vous encourage fortement à l'essayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059561891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 416, 'playtime_forever': 1046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 747, 'last_played': 1478326649}
review:
Upon loading up Star Vikings, you are greeted by the most ridiculous and catchy 80's Saturday morning cartoony intro song I have ever heard. The song was so catchy and over the top that even after beating this game, I still catch myself singing, "Staaarr viikings!!!" then laughing a bit as I remember the silliness that is Star Vikings.

I don't mean silly in any kind of derisive or mean way, but Star Vikings could be a satirical take on an 80's cartoon. My point is, that you aren't meant to take the overall aesthetic seriously, instead when you peel back the layers of this title, you are going to be presented with a clever and challenging puzzle game.

Star Vikings is a weird mash up of Plants Vs Zombies meets XCOM with a big helping of puzzle elements. Well, okay less XCOM, because every shot actually hits when you are standing right in front of the enemy. You get the idea. I know that sounds kinda weird but stick with me. I am going to go over the game mechanics first and then touch upon the more obvious traits of the game.

Starting with the PVZ aspects, the game takes some ideas from the mobile game department and presents to you an overworld map with about fifty levels total. Each planet has different enemy units, modifiers, story based objectives/random objectives, shops, and recruitment stations. Once you select a map you are actually brought into the game itself where your units appear on the left side of the screen. The basic gist of it is kill everything in your way while moving right down five lanes and completing objectives. Objectives can be things like: progress five screens worth of enemies, kill sixty enemies, or open five treasure chests. It all depends on the level and it really does a great job of keeping things fresh.

Just like Chess or PVZ, there are six classes total. Each is dynamically different in the method they deal with enemies, what they bring to a fight or how they move. The six classes are Shooter, Tank, Sneaky, Hunter, Valkyrie, and finally Berserker. This allows you essentially tackle puzzles in hundreds of different ways. Collecting five treasure chests will be completely different with a Berserker then it would be with a Shooter, as an example. It's this gameplay that makes Star Vikings very strategic and makes you think ahead. One wrong step and you will lose a unit. Thankfully, unlike XCOM the deaths are not permanent.(Hint hint Rogue snail, Ironman mode)

Enemies are also constantly changing their method of attack and the game is always upping the ante by introducing new threats. As an example is the addition of traps, or mimics.

Now the way the game reminds me of XCOM, is that not every one of the six classes are always going to be the same. You can recruit new vikings with all sorts of different innate buffs. These guys come with a heftier recruitment fee. I should mention gold and fuel is earned through completion of levels. I personally had a Striker and a Shooter with the ability to avoid death 50% of the time, this was vastly useful, but very expensive. The recruits/innate buffs are all randomized based on a timer that switches out what is available .

On top of that there are MORE customization of your units, as each class has a skill tree that changes how the class might attack, or buff fellow allies. Just like XCOM, as your units level, you pick one of two abilities and this really gives you the opportunity to craft a team and strategy of your own design. It's really awesome watching your Vikings become their own person that looks nothing like their base class. This gives the game extreme replayability and longevity for those of you that like to find the best min/max for class builds and team builds.

I am not done yet though, there are also hats that come with other innate bonuses which add to your characters stats and modifiers. But wait, there's more, you can purchase/find items that you can use in battle to give your Vikings an edge.

I don't know about you, but that doesn't sound like just a silly game about Vikings does it? It sounds freaking awesome. and it is. I was pleasantly surprised by the complexity and level of customization with my units. The puzzle aspects of the game continuously shine because of this, as there are a million ways to deal with a situation. It's like Chess but if your Pawn could suddenly do a backflip and throw an acid grenade, or your Queen could pull out an uzi.

There are some obvious strategies that do make the game rather easy, but I won't divulge those here. I mention that because by the end of the game I had my perfect five Vikings and nothing could stand in our way. To keep that from happening to often the game adds modifiers to certain stages. Normal stages are easy to plow through, but you begin to find levels with a fog modifier, plus five health, and plus two damage, suddenly all your best laid plans are getting put on hold.

What I am trying to basically sum up for you is don't judge this book by its cover. Star Vikings has its silly side true, but there is a deep game here.

The other areas of the game are going to be a hit and miss scenario from player to player. Funny is subjective and as Edmund Kean put it, "Dying is easy, comedy is hard." The game gave me a chuckle a couple of times and when a Viking bares his buttocks to his enemies, that is going to make me laugh. Are all the jokes funny? No. The animation style is very 80's cartoon and that isn't a bad thing. The battle animations are more of the PVZ variety with explosions, zaps, and other cartoon like effects. Again this isn't at all a negative for me but it is going to be up to you if you enjoy this style.

There is a minor story here about a Viking called Thork and his quest for a holy relic that he thinks is a table wedge, but I think that is best savored in game. 

In other areas the game is exceptionally well made. This comes from the team behind Chroma Squad, Relic Hunter Zero, so the attention to design, UI, and controls are top notch. Not once did the game crash on me nor did I have any issues whatsoever. The controls are extremely simple and this game is very child friendly. You could use this game to introduce young kids to puzzle, logic and strategy games. The music, as mentioned before, is really quite catchy. Sound effects all have their proper amount of gravitas behind them.

The one thing I did get caught off by was that this game is extremely mobile friendly but isn't, as far I am aware, on any mobile devices. I would've loved to play this on a pad device while sitting on my iron throne. The game is extremely addictive and I really hope that a mobile version is in the works. There is a leaderboard in the game but it mostly is for Trials of Valhalla, a level where the modifiers are constantly rising. I didn't play it all that much. I am not super competitive, but it is there.

For the low price of $10 you get about eight hours of gameplay out of the main story. There are plenty of side secret levels and things to experiment with, giving replay value and obviously the levels are procedural. There are Steam achievements but no Steam cards. The game is criminally under rated and think that this title was lost in the avalanche of Steam games. It's not changing the wheel for gaming and it is probably not super innovative, but it does things in its own unique way enough to warrant your attention.

So if you are looking for an adorable puzzle/strategy RPG to take up your time, give Star Vikings a chance and it might make you smile.

Ele é do gênero puzzle onde você tem que passar por missões com objetivos variados e assim atravessar casas (como em um jogo de tabuleiro) enquanto enfrenta inimigos. É algo simples, porém bacana, com elementos de RPG, permitindo aperfeiçoar sua equipe, análise detalhada aqui:

http://www.nerdmaldito.com/2016/10/star-vikings-um-jogo-peculiar-com.html

review:
If there would be a neutral I would pick that instead of negative.
The game is not bad, just not something I enjoy for longer time.

It just reminds me too much of a (free to play) mobile title with a lot of repetition and grinding.
For people who really enjoy the combat it may be a good investion, but there the game is just not tight enough for me.

I recomend all to try the demo, to see if you like the gameplay or not.


+ Quite unique puzzle gameplay.
+ The game is all in all quite well done, no big bugs noticed to now.
+ The characters play different, the enemies and the levels as well.
+ And there are upgrades which also change the way you play, making them more than gimmicks
+ There are quite some (optional) challenges later.

- The "random" generated levles can have big differences in difficulty
- The game seems to be made with mobile also in mind.
- The game gets a bit grindy and the randomness is not always fun.

review: While the aesthetics, reminiscent of PopCap's games, may lead some to believe that this is an easy game or that it's reliant on microtransactions, it's anything but. This game requires  thniking carefully about every move, in order to ontain the most loot and complete each level. There are plenty of classes and characters to unlock, the combo-based gameplay is simple yet addictive. It has a great sense of humor and laugh-out-loud moments. I highly reccomend it.
